New Records: Freddie Freeman won World Series MVP, hitting four homers and driving in 12 runs across the five games.
Freddie Freeman homered once each in the first four games of the series.
Shohei Ohtani, the presumptive NL MVP, won his first World Series.
Key Match Events: The Dodgers rallied from a 5-0 deficit to win 7-6 in Game 5.
The Yankees made three fielding miscues in the fifth inning, allowing the Dodgers to score five runs.
Freddie Freeman hit a two-run single with the bases loaded in the fifth inning.
Teoscar Hernández hit a two-run double to tie the game at 5 in the fifth inning.
Mookie Betts hit a sacrifice fly in the eighth inning to give the Dodgers their first lead of the game.
Gavin Lux hit a sacrifice fly to tie the game at 6 in the eighth inning.
Walker Buehler struck out Alex Verdugo for the final out to win the World Series.
Pre-Game Insights: Both teams brought back their starters from the opening game of the series, with Gerrit Cole for the Yankees and Jack Flaherty for the Dodgers.
The Dodgers were heavily favored to win the series despite the Yankees' Game 4 victory.
Post-Match Reflections: Freddie Freeman expressed his joy, saying, 'Every spring training this is our goal. For it to come true with this group of guys, I couldn’t ask for a better year. Holy cow.'

Dodgers reliever Blake Treinen said, 'This team has zero quit in it. If we don’t have the outcome that we want, there are always guys out there picking each other up and challenging ourselves to be better. That’s why we won tonight.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers have won two World Series in the last five years, having also won during the pandemic-shortened season in 2020.
Several players on this year’s Dodgers team were also on the World Series team in 2020, including Mookie Betts, Max Muncy, Kiké Hernández, and Walker Buehler.
It’s the third championship for manager Dave Roberts, who led Los Angeles in 2020 and also won once as a player in 2004 with the Boston Red Sox.
Shohei Ohtani signed a 10-year, $700 million contract with the Dodgers before the season and deferred $680 million of his salary to help the franchise spend more around him.
The Yankees have not won a World Series since 2009.
